Belgium: Arrival of Cardinal-Infante Ferdinand of Austria as new governor general.
Bhutan: Ngawang Namgyal prevails in the Battle of Five Lamas over the Tibetan Empire and Bhutanese forces allied against him. The Zhabdrung is thus the first to unite Bhutan into a single country. The Zhabdrung establishes the Drukpa Lineage as the state religion under the dual system of government, and codifies the system of laws known as the Tsa Yig, based on Buddhist religious law (dharma).
Canada: Trois-Rivières founded, becoming the second permanent settlement in New France.
China: The Chongzhen Emperor acquired the telescope of the late Johann Schreck.
Malta: A gunpowder factory explosion in Valletta kills 22 people.
Poland: Signing of the Treaty of Polanów concludes the Smolensk War
Russia: Smolensk War: The Muscovite army, surrounded, was forced to surrender.
Smolensk War: The Treaty of Polyanovka was signed, ending the war. Poland retained Smolensk, but Władysław renounced his claim to the Muscovite throne.
Taiwan: The Dutch forbid Chinese trade of deerskins to anyone but them
Liu Xiang attacks Fort Zeelandia in retaliation for their refusal to aid him against Zheng Zhilong, but fails
Chinese start planting sugarcane near Fort Provintia
USA: Theologian Roger Williams was banished from the Massachusetts Bay Colony.
